headlines.description: Nick Ward had 22 points and 14 rebounds, and No. 2 Michigan State rolled to a 111-61 victory over Cleveland State on Friday night, the third straight game for the Spartans with over 100 points.
headlines.shortLinkText: No. 2 Michigan State routs Cleveland State 111-61

video.headline: Michigan State beats Cleveland State by 50

headlines.description: Teddy Allen scored 15 points, leading six West Virginia players in double figures Friday night as the seventh-ranked Mountaineers rallied to an 85-79 victory over Oklahoma State in the Big 12 opener for both teams.
headlines.shortLinkText: No. 7 West Virginia rallies for 12th straight win

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCB Highlight (West Virginia edges Oklahoma State) 2017/12/29 ESHEET

headlines.description: Devonte' Graham had 23 points and eight assists, converting six 3-point baskets, and No. 11 Kansas defeated Texas 92-86 on Friday night in the Big 12 opener for both teams.
headlines.shortLinkText: Graham leads No. 11 Kansas past Texas 92-86

video.headline: Texas can't stick with Kansas despite Bamba's big day

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCB Highlight (Texas can't stick with Kansas despite Bamba's big day) 2017/12/29 ESHEET

headlines.description: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander came off the bench to score a career-high 24 points, PJ Washington added 16 and No. 16 Kentucky used several runs to blow out rival Louisville 90-61 Friday in the annual showdown for Bluegrass supremacy.
headlines.shortLinkText: No. 16 Kentucky blows out Louisville 90-61 in rivalry game

video.headline: Kentucky's young talent shines against Louisville

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCB Highlight (Kentucky's young talent shines against Louisville) 2017/12/28 SC6 ESHEET

headlines.description: Keenan Evans scored 18 points, freshman Zhaire Smith added 15 in his Big 12 debut and No. 22 Texas Tech rolled past 18th-ranked Baylor 77-53 in the conference opener for both teams Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: No. 22 Texas Tech tops No. 18 Baylor 77-53 in Big 12 opener

video.headline: Texas Tech's Francis, Smith hook up for dish and dunk

tracking.trackingName: NCB_One-Play (Texas Tech's Francis, Smith hook up for dish and dunk) 2017/12/29

headlines.description: Paul Jackson and Kevin McAdoo scored 12 points apiece and Eastern Michigan wrapped up its nonleague season with a 67-48 win over NAIA Rochester on Friday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Jackson, McAddo help E Michigan down Rochester 67-48

headlines.description: Sidney Umude scored 14 points, Mubashar Ali had a double-double and Southern cruised to a 99-57 win over Ecclesia on Friday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Umude scores 14, Southern rolls to 99-57 win over Eccelsia

headlines.description: Matty McConnell scored 18 points and Robert Morris took over down the stretch to open Northeast Conference play with a 68-54 win over Bryant on Friday, the Bulldogs' ninth-straight loss.
headlines.shortLinkText: McConnell's 18 leads Robert Morris past Bryant 68-54

headlines.description: Rasheem Dunn scored 16 points, Glenn Sanabria added 15 and Chauncey Hawkins made four free throws in the final 22 seconds to lift St. Francis (Brooklyn) to a 73-68 win over Sacred Heart in a Northeast Conference opener on Friday.
headlines.shortLinkText: St. Francis Brooklyn wins NEC opener 73-68 over Sacred Heart

headlines.description: Tre'Shaun Fletcher scored 16 of his 21 points in the second half, Jaelan Sanford added 19 points and Toledo pulled away in the final six minutes to defeat Penn 85-72 on Friday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Fletcher's 21, Sanford' 18 lead Toledo past Penn 85-72

headlines.description: Zachary Hamilton scored 25 points, Gary Blackston had 20 and Prairie View A&M ended an eight-game losing streak with a 110-80 win over NAIA Jarvis Christian on Friday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hamilton has 25, Blackston 20, Prairie View ends skid 110-80

headlines.description: Mike Holloway Jr. scored a career-high 27 points with nine rebounds and Fairleigh Dickinson ended a six-game losing streak by opening Northeast Conference play on Friday with an 82-71 win over LIU Brooklyn.
headlines.shortLinkText: Holloway's 29 leads Fairleigh Dickinson past LIU Brooklyn

headlines.description: Jermaine Crumpton tossed in 20 points and Jonathan Sanks came off the bench to score 12, including 1 of 2 free throws with 39 seconds left, to lift Canisius to a 77-76 victory over Rider on Friday in a Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference opener.
headlines.shortLinkText: Canisius outlasts Rider 77-76 in MAAC opener

headlines.description: Zach Johnson hit five 3-pointers and scored 19 with five assists and three steals to lead Florida Gulf Coast to a 76-42 victory over NAIA member Florida Memorial on Thursday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Florida Gulf Coast routs Florida Memorial 76-42

headlines.description: Malcolm Duvivier hit a career-high seven 3-pointers and finished with 24 points and six assists, Jimond Ivey also scored 24 points and Akron beat Division II Concord University 86-49 on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Duvivier, Ivey lead Akron past D-II Concord, 86-49

headlines.description: Tahjai Teague scored 16 points and Ball State defeated Florida A&M 75-54, winning its eighth straight in a final nonconference game Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Ball State defeats Florida A&M 75-54 for 8th-straight win

headlines.description: Jaylen Shaw totaled 26 points, seven rebounds and seven assists and Coastal Carolina stunned preseason favorite UT Arlington 90-65 on Friday night in a Sun Belt Conference opener.
headlines.shortLinkText: Coastal Carolina stuns UT Arlington in Sun Belt opener

headlines.description: Blake Francis scored 18 points, including four 3-pointers, Elijah Davis and JoJo Cooper each had a double-double and Wagner beat Mt. St. Mary's 76-57 on Friday night in the Northeast Conference opener for both teams.
headlines.shortLinkText: Francis hits 4 3s, scores 18; Wagner beat Mt. St. Mary's

headlines.description: Ryan Funk had 15 of his 17 points in the second half and hit all four of his 3-point attempts after the break as Marist held off a late rally from Siena to win 63-58 in the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference opener for both teams on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Marist holds off Siena 63-58 in MAAC opener

headlines.description: E.J. Crawford converted a 3-point play with about two minutes left in overtime and Iona closed with 10 straight free throws to hold off a challenge from Niagara 98-93 on Friday night in a Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference opener.
headlines.shortLinkText: Iona holds off Niagara 98-93 in overtime in MAAC opener

headlines.description: Zach Thomas scored 27 points, Nana Foulland added 26 points and 11 rebounds and Bucknell routed American 84-55 on Friday night in a Patriot League opener.
headlines.shortLinkText: Thomas, Foulland lead Bucknell in 84-55 rout of American

headlines.description: Cedric Hankerson hit five 3-pointers on his way to a season-high 33 points and Boston University turned back Army 90-82 in a Patriot League opener on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hankerson propels Boston University past Army, 90-82

headlines.description: Kahron Ross had 17 points, five rebounds and five assists and Pat Andree had his second career double-double to help Lehigh beat Lafayette 79-74 on Friday night in the Patriot League opener for both teams.
headlines.shortLinkText: Ross, Andree lead Lehigh past Lafayette, 79-74

headlines.description: Andre Walker scored nine of his 18 points in the last four minutes as Loyola of Maryland broke a late tie to sink Navy 72-63 in a Patriot League opener on Friday night punctuated by a Cam Gregory two-handed slam.
headlines.shortLinkText: Walker sparks late run, Loyola (Md) tops Navy 72-63

headlines.description: Jordan Swopshire scored a season-high 22 points and Will Rayman tallied 15 points and nine rebounds to help Colgate hold off Holy Cross 79-74 in a Patriot League opener on Friday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Swopshire leads Colgate past Holy Cross 79-74

headlines.description: Ronshad Shabazz scored 20 points, Justin Forrest added 14 points including a key 3-pointer, and Appalachian State closed on a 5-0 surge to beat Texas State 66-62 on Friday night in a Sun Belt opener.
headlines.shortLinkText: Appalachian State beats Texas State 66-62 in Sun Belt opener

headlines.description: Joe Hugley came off the bench to score 17 on 7-of-9 shooting and Central Connecticut State never trailed in a 72-68 victory over preseason favorite St. Francis (Pa.) in a Northeast Conference opener on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hugley lifts CCSU to 72-68 upset win over St Francis (PA)

headlines.description: Juwan Morgan scored 16 points and Robert Johnson added 13 to help Indiana close out its non-conference schedule with a 79-51 victory over Youngstown State on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Indiana takes advantage of strong 2nd half to ice Penguins

headlines.description: Luka Garza scored 25 points and Iowa cruised past Northern Illinois 98-75 for its fifth straight win.
headlines.shortLinkText: Garza scores 25, Iowa beats Northern Illinois 98-75

headlines.description: Kevin Huerter scored 20 points, and Maryland bounced back from a miserable first half to beat Maryland-Baltimore County 66-45 Friday night for its sixth straight victory.
headlines.shortLinkText: Huerter scores 20 as Maryland storms back to beat UMBC 66-45

video.headline: Huerter punishes the rim with a big Maryland slam

tracking.trackingName: NCB_One-Play (Huerter punishes the rim with a big Maryland slam) 2017/12/29 ESHEET

headlines.description: Tanner Borchardt came off the bench to score a career-high 8 points and grab 10 rebounds, all in the second half, and Nebraska pulled away from Stetson late to take a 71-62 win Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Borchardt big off the bench as Nebraska beats Stetson 71-62

headlines.description: JaKeenan Gant and Bryce Washington notched double-doubles and Louisiana opened Sun Belt Conference play with a 77-63 victory over Little Rock on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Gant, Washington lead Louisiana past Little Rock 77-63

headlines.description: Perrion Callandret scored 13 points on 5-of-8 shooting and Brayon Blake had 12 points and seven rebounds to help Idaho beat North Dakota 74-57 on Friday night in the Big Sky Conference opener for both teams.
headlines.shortLinkText: Callandret, Idaho beat North Dakota 74-57 in Big Sky opener

headlines.description: Tookie Brown poured in 31 points as Georgia Southern came from behind to knock off defending champion Troy 86-80 and reach a program milestone in a Sun Belt Conference opener Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Georgia Southern holds off Troy 86-80 in milestone win

headlines.description: Rodrick Sikes made 6 of 10 from 3-point range and scored 31 points, and South Alabama opened Sun Belt Conference play with an 86-64 win over Georgia State on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Sikes nets 31, leads South Alabama over Georgia State 86-64

headlines.description: Grantham Gillard scored 19 points, Tamas Bruce had 10 points and 11 rebounds and Arkansas State beat Louisiana-Monroe 75-64 on Friday night in a Sun Belt Conference opener.
headlines.shortLinkText: Arkansas State beats UL Monroe 75-64 in Sun Belt opener

headlines.description: Junior Dean Wade poured in a career-high 34 points, Kamau Stokes added 23 and Kansas State opened Big 12 play by pounding Iowa State 91-75 on Friday night for its first win in Ames since 2011.
headlines.shortLinkText: Wade drops 34, K-State pounds Iowa State 91-75

headlines.description: Andre Spight had 21 points and 10 rebounds to help Northern Colorado beat Eastern Washington 88-75 in the Big Sky Conference opener for both teams on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Spight, Northern Colorado top Eastern Washington 88-75

headlines.description: Justin Bibbins scored 16 of his 19 points in the second half to lead Utah to a 66-56 victory over Oregon on Friday night in the Pac-12 opener for both teams.
headlines.shortLinkText: Bibbins scores 16 of his 19 in second half; Utah tops Oregon

headlines.description: Noah Dickerson scored 17 points and grabbed seven rebounds to lead Washington to its first Pac-12 Conference road win in almost two years, a 88-81 victory over Southern California in a conference opener for both teams on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Dickerson leads Washington past Southern California

headlines.description: Stephen Thompson Jr. scored 22 of his 24 points in the second half and Oregon State cruised to a 76-57 win over Colorado on Friday night in the Pac-12 opener for both teams.
headlines.shortLinkText: Thompson Jr. scores 24, Oregon St. beats Colorado 76-57

headlines.description: Aaron Holiday scored a career-high 33 points and Jaylen Hands added 19 points to lead UCLA to a 96-82 victory over Washington State University Friday in the Pac 12 opener for both teams.
headlines.shortLinkText: Holiday with 33, UCLA opens Pac-12 96-82 over Washington St

headlines.description: Jack Purchase hit six 3-pointers and finished with 22 points -- both season bests -- to lead five Hawaii players in double figures and the Rainbow Warriors used a big second-half run to beat Howard 84-59 on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Purchase scores 22, leads Hawaii to 84-59 win over Howard

nowFeed.headline: USC junior forward Bennie Boatwright will miss the rest of the season after suffering a left patella injury during Thursday's win, per the school. Was averaging 13.6 points and 6.4 rebounds.
nowFeed.story: USC junior forward Bennie Boatwright will miss the rest of the season after suffering a left patella injury during Thursday's win, per the school. Was averaging 13.6 points and 6.4 rebounds.

nowFeed.headline: Back at @KUHoops Brings back a great memory thanks to a great group of players. @LBSUhoops https://t.co/aMhklA2Vbl
nowFeed.story: Back at @KUHoops Brings back a great memory thanks to a great group of players. @LBSUhoops vimeo.com/256137612

nowFeed.headline: Under Sean Miller Deandre Ayton is maximizing his enormous potential. Ayton has always possessed the physical tools and a solid basketball IQ. He has worked hard at Zona along with making the adjustments to college basketball. For a freshman big man it's really hard to dominate right away. Since he arrived in the states he was a top ranked player in his class. Would have been top 5 in last years NBA draft. Now he will be a top 3 pick and will be much more prepared.
nowFeed.story: Under Sean Miller Deandre Ayton is maximizing his enormous potential. Ayton has always possessed the physical tools and a solid basketball IQ. He has worked hard at Zona along with making the adjustments to college basketball. For a freshman big man it's really hard to dominate right away. Since he arrived in the states he was a top ranked player in his class. Would have been top 5 in last years NBA draft. Now he will be a top 3 pick and will be much more prepared.

nowFeed.headline:
The race for the No. 1 seeds is more wide open now after a few recent upsets. Per BPI, here's where we stand:

Virginia 99%
Villanova 98%
Purdue 71%
Michigan State 52%
Xavier 32%
Duke 29%
North Carolina 9%
Tennessee 4%
Auburn 3%
Kansas 2%

nowFeed.headline: Houston coach Kelvin Sampson said "good teams should win at home," including his Cougars, who are 13-0 this season at home, including Thursday's 67-62 upset of No. 5 Cincinnati.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati shot just 6-for-19 (31.6%) in the second half vs. Houston, including a FG drought of nearly 12 minutes down the stretch. The Bearcats got out rebounded 36-27. Both of those bit them tonight.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati shot just 6-for-19 (31.6%) in the second half vs. Houston, including a FG drought of nearly 12 minutes down the stretch. The Bearcats got out rebounded 36-27. Both of those bit them tonight.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati's loss at Houston will likely drop them from the No. 2-seed line in Joe Lunardi's Bracketology, with Texas Tech likely being the beneficiary to move up. The Cougars, who were a 10-seed coming into the night, scored another big resume win after picking one up over Wichita State in January.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati's loss at Houston will likely drop them from the No. 2-seed line in Joe Lunardi's Bracketology, with Texas Tech likely being the beneficiary to move up. The Cougars, who were a 10-seed coming into the night, scored another big resume win after picking one up over Wichita State in January.

nowFeed.headline: Houston upsets No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62, ending the Bearcats nation-leading 16-game winning streak. It's the first time the Cougars have beaten two top-10 opponents in a season since 1984.
nowFeed.story: Houston upsets No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62, ending the Bearcats nation-leading 16-game winning streak. It's the first time the Cougars have beaten two top-10 opponents in a season since 1984.

nowFeed.headline: Ironically, Cincinnati's loss to Houston also finally gives Cincinnati its first win over a likely NCAA Tournament team.
nowFeed.story: Ironically, Cincinnati's loss to Houston also finally gives Cincinnati its first win over a likely NCAA Tournament team.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati getting it done at the foul line tonight, hitting 17-of-21 free throw attempts. The Bearcats are hanging on to a 50-49 lead over Houston with 4:10 left.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati getting it done at the foul line tonight, hitting 17-of-21 free throw attempts. The Bearcats are hanging on to a 50-49 lead over Houston with 4:10 left.
